page.title: 02PLACE-NAMES NEAR HIGH CROSS.
page.content: The area around High Cross has a very interesting and long history. Most of the farm & village names are very old; {BARWICK}means "barley village". The manor of Gt.Barwick dates from C13th. {THUNDRIDGE}is from the Saxon god of thunder,"Thunor",or "Thor". {SWANGLES'FARM}was named after "De Swangalo",who came to Britain with Norman the Conqueror. {CASTLEBURY FARM}was called "Casewell" in C15th,when a mill was built here. {MARSHALLS'FARM}was named after "Robert Le Mareschal",from Normandy,in 1337. {YOUNGSBURY}was named after the French family of "Juvene",who lived in the area,in the early C13th. {NEWHALL FARM}was called "Le Newehalle" when,in 1326,it was given to the abbey at Waltham. {SAWTREES FARM}existed in C15th and was owned by the Dean of Canterbury Cath.
